marketNews.title: Bloomberg: Traders Claim Coalindo Index Distorts Indonesian Coal Prices
marketNews.content: Bloomberg reported that a group of Indonesian thermal coal exporters are demanding a replacement of the local Coalindo index in the calculation of the Indonesia Coal Index (ICI). They claim the index pushes Indonesian coal prices higher than other reference prices. The Coalindo index accounts for half of the ICI weighting, while the remaining price assessment comes from Argus Media Ltd. in the United Kingdom. Traders told Bloomberg that the ICI price with a GAR of 3,800 is about 5% higher than the reference price provided by Argus on 16 May 2025. This indicates that part of the ICI price is being driven up by a higher assessment from Coalindo, a distortion that has been widening since February 2025.

marketNews.title: Bloomberg: China-EU Trade Heads Meet to Counter U.S. Tariff Pressure
marketNews.content: Bloomberg reported that Chinese Commerce Minister Wang Wentao and European Commissioner for Trade and Competition Maroš Šefčovič will meet next month. This is the third meeting between Wang and Šefčovič since the beginning of 2025, and Bloomberg says the meeting signals that both sides will increase engagement to counter U.S. tariff pressure.

marketNews.title: Reuters: India’s Soybean Acreage Likely to Shrink as Farmers Favor Corn and Sugarcane
marketNews.content: India’s soybean acreage is expected to shrink this year as corn and sugarcane replace it in some regions, according to farmers and industry officials speaking to Reuters. Soybean, the country’s main oilseed crop, is usually planted in the summer. The lower potential soybean-oil output could force India – the world’s largest vegetable-oil importer – to increase purchases of Indonesian and Malaysian crude palm oil, soybean oil and sunflower oil.

marketNews.title: Trump Says He May Impose More Sanctions on Russia
marketNews.content: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday (26 May) that he is open to imposing additional sanctions on Russia, though he gave no further details. The statement came in response to a large-scale Russian air strike campaign against Ukraine over the previous three days.

marketNews.title: Minister Says Civil Servant Pension Age Extension Proposal Needs Careful Review
marketNews.content: Indonesia’s Ministry of State Apparatus Governance and Bureaucratic Reform Minister Rini Widyantini said on Monday (26 May) that the Civil Servants Corps (Korpri) had not coordinated with the government before the civil-servant pension age extension proposal. Previously, Korpri had suggested extending the retirement age to a range of 59-70 years. Rini said the proposal must be examined carefully, taking into account productivity, career development and competency building.

marketNews.title: Indosat Director Ritesh Kumar Singh Resigns Effective 31 July 2025
marketNews.content: Indosat Ooredoo Hutchison ($ISAT) announced that Ritesh Kumar Singh has submitted a resignation letter from his position as director, effective 31 July 2025.

marketNews.title: BJTM Announces 2024 Dividend of IDR 821.5 billion
marketNews.content: East Java Regional Development Bank (BJTM) will distribute a 2024 dividend of approximately IDR 821.5 billion, or IDR 54.71 per share. The payout ratio is about 64% versus 2023’s 56%, implying a dividend yield of 9.7% on Tuesday (27 May). The cum-date is the regular market, the negotiation date is 3 June 2025, and the payment date is 19 June 2025.

marketNews.title: HATM Announces Rights Issue to Raise Approximately IDR 537.6 billion
marketNews.content: Habco Trans Maritima ($HATM) plans a rights issue of about 1.7 billion new shares at an execution price of IDR 320 per share, a 25:6 ratio, resulting in a 19.35% dilution. The expected proceeds of roughly IDR 537.6 billion will be used to repay a principal loan of IDR 461.8 billion to Bank Central Asia ($BBCA) and the remainder for capex related to ship repair and maintenance. The cum-date is the regular market, the negotiation date is 5 June 2025, and the trading and execution period is 13-19 June 2025.

marketNews.title: Uang Nganggur, Bukan Uang Dapur: Mental Buffer in Volatile Markets
marketNews.content: The quote from IPOHunter2 on Stockbit reads: “Relying on kitchen-money for investment only adds emotional pressure and leads to reckless decisions when the market wavers. In contrast, idle cash gives space for patience and rationality – two essential qualities in the stock market.”

tickerNews.title: BMRI: Net Profit Flat in 4M25, NIM Pressure and Cost-of-Credit Below Guidance
tickerNews.content: Bank Mandiri ($BMRI) recorded a decline in net profit for April 2025 due to the seasonal effect of the Lebaran holiday. Bank-only net profit fell 10% year-on-year (YoY) and 12% month-on-month (MoM). Over the first four months of 2025 (4M25) the bank-only net profit was essentially flat, up 1% YoY. Net interest margin (NIM) fell to 4.26% versus 4.64% in 4M24. Net interest income grew 6% YoY, but higher interest expense outweighed the increase, pulling NIM down. Loan growth slowed to 15% YoY in April 2025, down from about 19% YoY earlier in the year and moving toward the management’s 2025 guidance of 10-12% YoY. Deposit growth was strong (+23% YoY) while CASA grew 12% YoY, supporting the loan-to-deposit ratio. Provision expense fell 9% YoY, keeping cost-of-credit (CoC) below 1% for the period. Pre-provision operating profit (PPOP) was flat, with a 1% YoY decline because a 15% YoY rise in non-interest income was offset by a 26% YoY rise in operating expenses. The bank’s performance was roughly in line with the consensus expectation of a 1.5% YoY increase in consolidated net profit for 2025, but below the consensus for BBNI.

tickerNews.title: BBNI: Net Profit Flat in 4M25, Below Consensus
tickerNews.content: Bank Negara Indonesia ($BBNI) posted a decline in net profit for April 2025, down 5% YoY and 28% MoM. Over 4M25 the bank-only net profit was flat at 0% YoY, missing the consensus forecast of a 4% YoY increase for 2025. Net interest margin stayed flat at 3.69% versus 3.68% in 4M24, below the 2025 guidance. Net interest income grew 3% YoY, while interest expense rose faster, compressing NIM. Loan growth slowed to 8% YoY in April 2025, at the low end of the 8-10% YoY guidance. Deposit growth fell 7% YoY, dragging deposit growth rate down, while CASA grew 12% YoY. Cost-of-credit was flat at +1% YoY. PPOP rose 1% YoY. The bank’s cost-of-credit remained under the 2025 guidance.

tickerNews.title: TLKM Approves 2024 Dividend, New President Director and New President Commissioner
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of Telkom Indonesia approved a dividend for the 2024 financial year of roughly IDR 21 trillion, or IDR 212.5 per share, representing about an 89% dividend payout ratio (2023: 72%) and implying a 7.5% dividend yield as of Tuesday 27 May. The cum-date and negotiation date have not been announced. Shareholders also approved the appointment of Dian Siswarini, former XL Axiata CEO, as the new president director, replacing Ririek Adriansyah. In addition, Angga Raka Prabowo, a Gerindra politician and current deputy minister of communications and digital, was appointed as the new president commissioner, replacing Bambang Permadi Soe mantri Brodjonegoro.

tickerNews.title: DEWA Announces IDR 942 Billion Heavy-Equipment Purchase
tickerNews.content: Darma Henwa announced that the company has made a strategic investment by procuring heavy-equipment from PT XCMG Group Indonesia worth IDR 942 billion. The equipment will be used for future potential projects, increasing internal production capacity, improving project execution efficiency, and is expected to boost revenue, profit margin and cost structure in the medium to long term.

tickerNews.title: MPMX Declares 2024 Dividend of IDR 535 billion
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of Mitra Pinasthika Mustika approved a 2024 dividend of about IDR 535 billion, or IDR 120 per share, representing a 92% payout ratio (2023: 96%) and a dividend yield of roughly 10.9% on Tuesday 27 May. The cum-date and payment date have not been announced.

tickerNews.title: HMSP Announces 2024 Dividend of IDR 6.5 trillion
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of Hanjaya Mandala Sampoerna approved a 2024 dividend of about IDR 6.5 trillion, or IDR 56.2 per share, representing a 98% payout ratio (2023: ~100%) and a dividend yield of 8.6% on Tuesday 27 May. The cum-date is the regular market, the negotiation date is 10 June 2025 and the payment date is 26 June 2025.

tickerNews.title: WIIM Targets 20% SKM Volume Growth and 15% SKT Growth in 2025
tickerNews.content: Wismilak Inti Makmur said its management targets a 20% year-over-year increase in machine-rolled kretek (SKM) volume and a 15% YoY rise in hand-rolled kretek (SKT) volume in 2025. The SKT segment remains in tier 2 (production cap of 2 billion sticks) and the company aims to approach that threshold gradually. For the filter segment, WIIM targets a 10-15% YoY volume increase in 2025 as new machines are added.

tickerNews.title: CLEO Plans IDR 500 Billion 2025 Capex for New Plants in Palu, Pontianak and Pekanbaru
tickerNews.content: CLEO’s director Nio Eko Susilo said the company is preparing a capital expenditure program of IDR 500 billion in 2025 (2024 allocation was IDR 600 billion). By the first quarter of 2025, 30-40% of the capex plan had been absorbed, mainly for new plant construction. The new plants, worth a total of IDR 200 billion, will be built in Palu, Pontianak and Pekanbaru. Director Toto Sukartono said the facilities will expand distribution to the Riau Islands, Central Sulawesi and West Sumatra. CLEO targets double-digit sales and net-profit growth in 2025.

tickerNews.title: NRCA Declares 2024 Dividend of IDR 53.3 billion
tickerNews.content: Nusa Raya Cipta announced a 2024 dividend of about IDR 53.3 billion, or IDR 22 per share, representing a 65% payout ratio (2023: ~70%) and a dividend yield of 6.5% on Tuesday 27 May. The cum-date is the regular market, the negotiation date is 4 June 2025 and the payment date is 24 June 2025.

tickerNews.title: Key Takeaway: Liquidity Remains a Constraint on NIM, CoC Below Guidance
tickerNews.content: The quote from the BMRI snips article (link) and the BBNI snips article (link) note that both management teams expect Net Interest Margin to stay weak in the first half of 2025 before strengthening in the second half as liquidity eases. They cite three possible catalysts that could improve banking liquidity: 1) a reduction in the central bank’s policy rate, 2) secondary-reserve liquidity provided by Bank Indonesia, and 3) capital inflows to Indonesia.
